The primary purpose of this survey is to gauge interest.

Vallivue School District Admin Team

post_text: The University of Idaho's College of Engineering showcased Vallivue Middle School's field trip to the StreamLab. Check it out!
shared_text:
University of Idaho College of Engineering is with Kristal Mann and TJ Karren.
September 20, 2019 at 5:58 PM Â·

About 50 middle school students from Vallivue School District visited the University of Idaho - Boise this week to learn about the science of whitewater and sediment and participate in hands-on activities.

Students visited that the StreamLab, a the large-scale sediment flume that allows researchers to physically model headwater streams and mountain rivers with unique scalable and computer-controlled instrumentation.

Over the summer, Heidi Maimer, a middle school science teacher from Vallivue, spent five weeks and 200 hours working with researchers in the StreamLab.

Her work was part of an externship program to better connect education to careers and set up through U of I's Center for Ecohydraulics Research, the Idaho Workforce Development Council and the Idaho STEM Action Center.
